title: Being solo and having a team report
body: Riot should do something about teams reporting a single person because 1 of the teammates didn't like the way u played and so u get a 3-4 man report for no reason. This has to be the dumbest thing ever! So I play teemo that doesn't mean u don't help him just because u dont like the champ, I'm on the team too and just to ignore that person setting him to fail is so BS! A team should only be able to report 1 time, I only get to report 1 time as they get to report me 3-4 times. BS in my eyes!!!!

Did you know that 1 report is the exact same weight as 9 reports on the same person in a game?  Also, false reports do absolutely nothing.  You won't receive a correction unless you did something wrong.

haha. 

how completely wrong.

Multiple reports increase the likelihood of flagging your account for review. So unless you are picture perfect in every single game, they do in fact count quite a bit
Multiple reports do NOT increase the likelihood of flagging a game for review. One report is all it takes. There is no benefit to asking for others to report a player.

I really wish the above message would be displayed on-screen in game whenever someone uses the word "report" in chat.
Preferably alongside blocking the triggering message from being sent.

Or as one of those weird bumps we get during the loading screen. No one cares Illaoi was GP's first love!

All right I do enjoy some trivia but that sounds like it'd be pretty helpful.

>Preferably alongside blocking the triggering message from being sent.

I dunno. Some people do say "report" in a certain appropriate situations.

"Report, soldier!" for dem Azir mains or

"Report me for feeding" if you die to a bot in an AI game. Obviously a joke, though.
At this point, I must admit I've seen the word "report" thrown about so much that "report me" jokes are decidedly *not* funny any more.
Well, at least you're honest.

which is weird because i constantly everyone saying report X player on both mine and the enemy team.

We could even argue and say that's being toxic because now you're going to make the person playing feel/play terrible because now you have people that will report you no matter what you do, even if you didn't break any rules.

People think multiple reports matter and preasure others to do it so the person gets banned.
If you did nothing wrong and someone reports you, you have nothing to worry about. The reports will be shrugged and their future reports will weigh less.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/tvviuURj-multiple-reports-and-other-misconceptions

And report weight is actually why multiple reports matter, since your can be lower due to numerous reports, but your teammates can have more impact... :D So till there are different levels of account credibility, multiple reports do have weight, since more people reporting = bigger chance of getting caught by credible player...
That was the old system. 3 years ago? We have since then iterated many times that only one report is needed to flag games.
Could you clarify; are you saying there is no such thing as report weight at all with the IFS?

Confirmed. Reports do not lose value based upon the number of times you report players.

This used to be the case. It is no longer true.

In other words, even for false reporting making it less likely to trigger a case review? I just have to be clear on this so myself and other volunteers and the Arbiters are giving out only the most accurate info.
Yes. Every single report triggers a review.

Yes, every time a game is reported, it is reviewed by the system.

That is why we say only 1 report is needed.
Every time a match is reported the player is reviewed? I thought a review doesn't happen until the case gets big enough.

So, if my 1 report flagged the Thresh I had in my game that ran down the mid lane and died on purpose....is that just deemed to not be intentionally feeding? Or is intentionally feeding not bannable anymore, just like going AFK over and over again and trolling isn't?

so does this mean i can simply report all 9 players for unsportsmanlike conduct and verbal abuse every single game, and the people who were actually toxic will still be flagged?

Clarity questions so I can convey information correctly.

This is what I tell others:

> Multiple reports is like asking a bunch of people in the same room "are the lights currently on?", the answer is always the same. 
>
> If the review's answer is "yes, there was toxicity", then that one game (not number of reports) will be added to a person's case. 

Does this properly describe the system?

When you say "a game is reported", does it audit every player in the games or only the one who receives reports?

What's the point of filling in the text box explaining your report, by the way? Can the machine understand it?

It is reportable and punishable. Since the review is automated it can be hard to be detected. I got once trolled by a 4 man premate group (banning my champ, taunting and insulting me in champ selection) and came to the stupid conclusion to not give them the satisfaction of a dodge. (horrible decision in hindsight). Well I ran it down mid and got instantly banned after 9 years of not being punished before. What I learned from that was that the report system actually works and it doesn't matter how often and how many people report you. If you do stupid stuff you get punished.

We've been trying to conciliate all these things since, and imagine an overall system where it might be true.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9VrUtrJo,comment-id=000000000002,timestamp=2016-05-23T17:35:27.493+0000)
>
> Multiple reports do NOT increase the likelihood of flagging a game for review. One report is all it takes. There is no benefit to asking for others to report a player.

how does that work in regards to report weight then? why does report weight even exist if this is the case. i would greatly appreciate if riot would stop pussyfooting around this question
Maybe because they don't want people to abuse/avoid their system?

Security through obscurity is the shittiest security logic, right after not having any.

So tell me, how do you abuse a system like this:

If you report spam, your reports are meaningless.
If you ask for reports, you can get banned in return.
Only one report is needed to trigger a case - Obvious lie. I'm reporting toxic individuals on regular basis and have yet to see a pop-up after, I report somebody, who sports with a text like _"go kill yourself irl"_ or _"uninstall, you worthless effing feeder"_ at least once per 5 minutes.
"One report per game is maximum" doesn't mean just one flagged game is enough.

There's still the problem of report weight. A serial reporter whose report don't matter for poo could hone more entrusted members of the community into reporting that same person.

I am aware that in the end it doesn't really change the state of things given that if the reports aren't valid, report weight won't change anything. However, the claim that 9 reports can have more influence than 1 is partially true, in that 9 reports have the value of the highest valued report out of those 9.

>However, the claim that 9 reports can have more influence than 1 is partially true, in that 9 reports have the value of the highest valued report out of those 9.

Excellent point. Well done.
Please, please pleeasseee make that a tip in game, because that would save many accounts from being toxic
Oh, really? Well this is good to learn. Is there actually a team of people who review each and every report? That must get busy.

The only thing reports do is trigger reviews of your behavior. No amount of reports changes what that review finds, only when it is triggered.

Your behavior gets you punished, not reports.

Reports from premades are in fact treated as only 1 report, precisely in order to counter groups taking advantage of their numbers to report someone they don't like. Reports from multiple groups or individuals do still count separately, though.
Why would reports from premades have to be treated as only 1 report if 9 reports are treated as 1 anyway tho?

A single game can be weighted more heavily if multiple groups/individuals report someone separately. 9 separate reports from individual players are not counted as a single report. It's a common misconception, but it makes little difference; if you're getting reported by every single player in a game, at minimum that's 2 entirely separate groups that decided to report you, and they probably have a somewhat valid reason for it.

Basically just don't worry about getting ganged up on by a premade for no reason. If you did nothing wrong, you won't be punished, even if their entire group reports you.
So what youre saying is that 9 reports do more than 1 and asking for reports does help?

It gives it slightly more weight, but it won't get them punished any faster. No, that's not quite it. It might get them punished faster (no proof of that yet), but it will not cause a punishment for a single game of mildly toxic behavior just because every single person decided to report it. One report flags the game just the same as 9 reports, but 9 may give that game more weight when considering a punishment. Might affect the severity of the punishment, but not the speed at which it is dispensed.

Asking for reports still does not improve the situation at all. Most likely it'll just make the person play or behave worse, further ruining the game.
